skill.name: webapp-testing
skill.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, capturing browser screenshots, and viewing browser logs.

skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with minimal attack surface. Uses subprocess and socket APIs only for local server management. All file operations restricted to /tmp and /mnt/user-data/outputs. No external network calls.

content.user_title: Test local web applications with Playwright
content.value_statement: Testing local web applications requires browser automation, screenshot capture, and UI verification. This toolkit provides Playwright scripts for frontend testing, DOM inspection, and console logging.
actual_capabilities: Automate browser interactions with Playwright for local web apps
Discover and inspect page elements including buttons, links, and inputs
Capture screenshots of rendered pages for visual verification
Capture and analyze browser console logs during automation
Manage multiple local servers with automatic lifecycle control
Test static HTML files using file:// URLs
limitations: Only supports Chromium browser for headless automation
Designed for local development servers, not production URLs
Does not include performance benchmarking or load testing features

use_cases.title: Verify UI functionality
use_cases.description: Test that buttons, forms, and navigation work correctly in your local development environment.

use_cases.title: Automated UI regression
use_cases.description: Create repeatable Playwright scripts to verify frontend behavior across code changes.

use_cases.title: Capture console errors
use_cases.description: Run browser automation to capture console logs and identify JavaScript errors in local apps.

prompt_templates.title: Take a screenshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Take a screenshot of the running app at localhost:5173 and save it to /tmp/inspect.png.

prompt_templates.title: Find page elements
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all buttons, links, and input fields on the page at localhost:3000 and list them with their text or labels.

prompt_templates.title: Capture console logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to the app, capture all console messages, and save them to a log file for debugging.

prompt_templates.title: Run multi-server test
prompt_templates.prompt: Start the backend server on port 3000 and frontend on port 5173, then run element_discovery.py to verify the full stack is working.

output_examples.input: Take a screenshot of the app and list all buttons

best_practices: Use the bundled with_server.py script to manage server lifecycle automatically
Always wait for networkidle state before inspecting dynamic web applications
Close browser instances properly after automation completes
anti_patterns: Do not inspect DOM before waiting for networkidle on dynamic applications
Do not leave browser processes running after script completion
Do not skip using sync_playwright for simple automation tasks

faq.question: Which browsers are supported?
faq.answer: This toolkit uses Chromium in headless mode for all automation tasks.

faq.question: What is the maximum test duration?
faq.answer: Server timeout defaults to 30 seconds. Configure with --timeout flag for longer startup times.

faq.question: Can I test remote production URLs?
faq.answer: Designed for local development servers. Production URL testing requires additional configuration.

faq.question: Is my test data stored securely?
faq.answer: All outputs save to /tmp or /mnt/user-data/outputs with automatic cleanup recommendations.

faq.question: Why is my DOM inspection failing?
faq.answer: Wait for networkidle state before inspection. Dynamic apps may render content after initial page load.

faq.question: How does this compare to Selenium?
faq.answer: Playwright offers faster execution, better async support, and more reliable waiting mechanisms for modern web apps.
